derivation: from G5384 (φιλόστοργος) and (cherishing one's kindred, especially parents or children);
strongs_def: fond of natural relatives, i.e. fraternal towards fellow Christian
outline:
1. the mutual love of parents and children and wives and husbands
  2. loving affection, prone to love, loving tenderly
    1. chiefly of the reciprocal tenderness of parents and children
